author: Phil Vickery
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Place the pastry onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to 1cm/½in thick. Brush the pastry with the beaten egg and sprinkle with the caster sugar. Roll up the pastry like a Swiss roll and slice into 1cm/½in rounds. Place the palmiers onto a non-stick baking sheet and bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the pastry is risen and golden-brown. To serve, remove from the oven, dust with icing sugar and place into bowls with cream.
ingredients: 255g/8oz ready-made puff pastry,  flour, for dusting,  1 free-range egg, lightly beaten,  100g/3½oz caster sugar,  icing sugar, to dust,  double cream, to serve
